documents.title: coming up on tv : west midlands pays tribute on armistice day ; preparations for children in need

that and more on midlands today from 18:30 on bbc one .

documents.title: police plan to deport thieves
text: police have revealed they will work to deport two romanian nationals jailed for a string of distraction thefts .
bogdan vranceanu , 31 , and atena calin , 20 , both of no fixed abode , were sentenced to six months and three months respectively after admitting five counts of theft each .
between 13 september and 26 september this year , 10 people had purses stolen while shopping in supermarkets in shrewsbury , malvern , droitwich , leominster , kidderminster , evesham and hereford .
west mercia police det seg julie shephard called the pair `` skilled fraudsters '' .

documents.title: # bigthankyouget inspired
text: do you know someone who does that little bit extra to make sport happen ?
why not give them a chance to get a call from their sporting hero from the bbc sports personality of the year red carpet ?

the # bigthankyou is britain 's biggest celebration of sports volunteers and recognises the thousands of unsung heroes who give up their time to work tirelessly so others can enjoy many sport and fitness activities .
find out more here .

documents.title: trump 'could be good for region 's exporters '
text: business leaders in the west midlands are at a post usa election breakfast this morning and there 's been a mixed reaction to the overnight result .
paul forrest from west midlands economic forum said a trump presidency could be good for exporters in the region .
during the eu referendum , president obama warned that britain would `` go to the back of the queue '' if people voted for brexit .
however , speaking at the beginning of this month , donald trump 's trade adviser said britain would be first for a trade deal under a trump presidency .
author: Kathryn Stanczyszyn
Political Reporter, BBC WM

documents.title: paramedics : rise in attacks on staff fuelled by substances formerly called 'legal highs '
text: there 's been an `` explosion '' in parts of the midlands in the number of people who 've taken substances which used to be called legal highs .
police forces are saying there 's increasing use , and that , according to west midlands ambulance service , is leading to more attacks on paramedics trying to help those under the influence .
but many of the traditional methods to treat users do n't work because crews do n't always know what 's in the substances .
author: BBC Midlands Today

text: it looks like it 's going to be chilly overnight and there 's even a chance of snow , according to the met office which has issued a yellow alert .
yellow alert of snow for west midlands

documents.title: sir lenny goes back to school
text: sir lenny henry 's been back to school in the west midlands as he brings shakespeare to the classroom .
the number of children going on school trips to the theatre has fallen in recent years - so the national theatre has begun screening plays in secondary schools instead .
with this you can watch live shows done by the national theatre - arguably the best theatre group in the world and you can have it at your finger tips .
there are work packages , you can dissect the text - it 's really exciting and kids deserve access to the arts and this is it in spades

documents.title: weather : a clear night and some sunshine tomorrow
text: it 's going to remain chilly , but it should be a clear night and we could have some sunshine in shropshire tomorrow .
author: Rebecca Wood
BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: watch : rspca explains plans for rescued otters
text: so , what next for the rescued shropshire otters , after their release into a pen this afternoon ?
the rspca has set up a large enclosure at a secret location in shropshire and set mary and joseph loose in it earlier .
we spoke to rspca officer rob scriven .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : hurst says shrewsbury stadium not intimidating
text: the new shrewsbury manager paul hurst says the atmosphere at the greenhous meadow is n't that intimidating for opposing players .
he says he wants the home fans to get behind their players when they face barnet tomorrow .
this will be hurst 's first game in front of the home fans and he was quick to add he does n't mean to offend the shrewsbury supporters .
i do n't think it 's anywhere near an intimidating place to come .
the fans here are not the most hostile and that 's not a criticism because everywhere 's different .
but ( at ) certain grounds fans are known for giving the opposition a very hard time . ''
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: your photos : a chilly autumn day around shropshire
text: we 've had more blue skies to end to the day and the bbc weather watchers have been sending in some beautiful autumnal photos from around the county .
these ones were taken near llanymynech ( top ) and norton ( bottom ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: watch : horse box is converted into mobile photo booth
text: a 19-year-old shropshire woman has come up with a novel use for an old horse-box - she 's turned it into a mobile photo-booth .
gemima brettell from marchamley , near shrewsbury , is taking it to weddings , festivals and other events and has decorated the inside to look like a country house .
we asked her to show us around .
author: Adam & Vicki Show

documents.title: headlines : new hope for factory workers ; police investigate 'black van ' incident ; new home for rescued otters

- under-threat telford factory workers thrown potential lifeline
- police investigate another sus `` black van '' incident involving children
- rescued shropshire otters find new home at secret location
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: renewed hope for workers at telford factory
text: there 's fresh hope for workers at the link 51 pallet racking factory in telford , following talks between management and the unite union .
the factory 's owner , whittan storage systems , says it is considering creating 40 new roles , which might partially offset the loss of 69 jobs , announced on monday .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your west midlands questions answered
text: your west midlands questions answered

documents.title: football : tns travel to third-placed bangor
text: the new saints of oswestry have a trip up the welsh coast tomorrow , to face third-placed bangor city .
the game is a 17:15 kick off because it 's on s4c and it 's another chance for tns to punish a team just below them in the table , after their victory over second-placed connah 's quay last weekend .
of course , when we say `` just below them in the table '' we are talking a massive 15 points below them , because of the impressive start to the season tns have made , not dropping a single point .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: environment agency tidy up shrewsbury bridge
text: a team from the environment agency have been hard at work , clearing plants from the edge of the river severn in shrewsbury , down by the english bridge .
before & after photos of english bridge in # shrewsbury .
our # shropshire team have been clearing the area to reduce flood risk # floodaware

documents.title: watch : rescued otters released into new home
text: two otters , rescued from last winter 's floods , have been given a new home this afternoon .
mary and joseph have been looked after at a wildlife centre near nantwich since they were found near the banks of the river severn in shrewsbury at christmas .
we 'd been expecting them to be released into the river , but we 've now been told they 'll wait in this outdoor pen for a fortnight first .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: west midlands nhs millions in the red
text: nhs trusts in the west midlands have a deficit of almost £ 200m between them , a bbc sunday politics investigation has found .
many are blaming bed blocking , and the lack of investment in social care by local councils .
while telford clinical commissioning group is operating with a £ 2.6m surplus , it 's a different stories elsewhere in the county .
as of march 2016 , shropshire ccg had a £ 14.5m deficit , while shrewsbury and telford hospital nhs trust recorded an £ 8.4m deficit .
more on sunday politics this weekend at 11:00 on bbc one .
author: James Bovill
Political Reporter, BBC News

documents.title: football : shrewsbury captain wants more happy cup memories
text: shrewsbury town are at home to league two barnet in the fa cup tomorrow and it 's a chance for them to take their minds off the league .
it will also be a chance to lift the mood with another cup run , something the captain adam el-abd has experienced before .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: headlines : investigations after girl 'followed by van ' ; barracks plans questioned ; children 's illustrator dies
text: here 's a look at our headlines this afternoon :
- police investigate possible link with shropshire incidents after schoolgirl `` followed by man '' in van in chirk
- concerns raised over shrewsbury barracks housing plans
- former ellesmere college pupil who illustrated peter and jane books dies
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: highways department says barracks plans need more work
text: a proposal to build homes on the site of shrewsbury 's former copthorne barracks needs more work , according to shropshire council 's highway 's department .
an agency selling the land on behalf of the mod is looking to get outline planning permission for 174 homes and nine flats there , plus 45 retirement flats , before it finds a buyer .
the authority 's highways department is one of a number of groups invited to comment on the plans , which will go before councillors at a later date .
and while it accepts the site is a suitable one for a development like this , it is n't happy with some of the evidence the agency is using to support its application .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: ice hockey : tigers face milton keynes twice in two days
text: telford tigers play milton keynes lightning home and away this weekend and will be trying to make sure that old saying about lightning remains true .
with milton keynes also pushing for the epl title , the tigers head coach knows the games could prove pivotal and says his players know what is at stake .
watkins has been away for part of the week , coaching the great britain team and has been keeping in touch with his players while he was away , saying he knows these games have been on their minds .
it 's still just two points each night , but these are the games that are really fun .
guys always come to play and get up for them a little bit more . ''

documents.title: schoolgirl 'followed by van driver '
text: there 's been another report of a man in a black van acting sus around schoolchildren - this time in chirk .
last month , there were reports of two attempts to up schoolchildren in the oswestry area and in both instances a black car or van was reported , police say .
west mercia police have previously urged parents in the area not to let their children walk to school alone .
north wales police say this latest incident took place at 17:55 last night and that after the man got out of his vehicle and followed the girl for a distance , she ran away .
we are aware of similar reports in shropshire in recent weeks and we are in touch with our colleagues at west mercia police .
we have increased patrols in the area to reassure the public . ''

documents.title: your photos : deep blue skies broken by white cloud
text: it 's been chilly outside , but the skies have been a brilliant dark blue in places , broken up by patches of white cloud .
these photos were taken by bbc weather watchers at clun ( top ) and near badger ( below ) .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: schoolgirl followed by man in black van chirk
text: police are investigating after a schoolgirl reported that she had been followed by a man who got out of a black van in chirk .
author: Oswestry and Borders Chronicle

documents.title: peter and jane children 's books illustrator dies
text: an artist who went on to illustrate the peter and jane reading books and helped teach a generation to read has died .
martin aitchison , who was educated at ellesmere college , was 96 and his obituary in the telegraph describes how he was recruited by ladybird after a spell illustrating the eagle comic .
during world war two he illustrated service manuals for vickers aircraft .
afterwards he turned his attention to comics , until getting a job with ladybird in 1963 that would last more than 20 years .

documents.title: sport england boss praises shropshire 's sporting achievements
text: the chief executive of sport england is hailing shropshire as a stand-out rural county for sporting achievement .

jennie price , originally from newport , was at the telford international centre last night for the energize county sports awards , where a range of awards were won by paralympic medallists , through to amateur club volunteers .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: football : telford lose coach wynn
text: rob smith has lost a member of his coaching team .
steve wynn , who coached the first team , has worked with smith for 15 years and has been alongside him during both of his spells as telford manager - he has gone because of work commitments .
rob smith said wynn has done a `` really good job '' since coming to the bucks head , but that his other job was taking up more and more of his time and he had been forced to make a choice .
i 'm gutted really because he 's a good friend , but work is more important . ''
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : telford company fined over band deaths ; hospital review delay plea ; otters returned to wild
text: our headlines this lunchtime :
- telford company fined £ 30,000 over band deaths
- shropshire council leader calls for end to hospital review delays
- rescued otters returned to river in shropshire
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: rescued otters to be returned to river
text: two baby otters which were flooded out of their home in shrewsbury last christmas , are due to be released back into the wild this afternoon .
the rspca named them mary and joseph and they have been living at its wildlife centre near nantwich in a specially built otter enclosure .
now about a year old , they 're being released at a secret location on the river severn in shropshire .
author: Kate Tebby
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: breakingtelford company fined £ 30,000 over band deaths
text: a telford company has been fined £ 30,000 for health and breaches , in connection with the death of two men from the cornish shanty band fisherman 's friends .
express hi-fold doors ltd supplied a two-tonne door that fell , fatally injuring the pair at the g live venue in guildford in 2013 .
mrs justice whipple issued the sentence , the day after a jury of six women and five men found the company guilty .
david naylor , the director and founder of the company , was not in court .
yesterday he was cleared of two counts of manslaughter by gross negligence , in relation to the deaths of singer trevor grills and tour manager paul mcmullen .

documents.title: weather : some sunshine and a clear night ahead
text: we 're forecast a little bit of sunshine this afternoon , but it 's going to stay chilly and it 's going to be a clear night .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: 2018 date given for shrewsbury student halls plan
text: plans to build hundreds of student rooms in the centre of shrewsbury could become a reality by 2018 , according to council bosses .
author: Shrewsbury Chronicle

documents.title: football : new shrewsbury boss looks ahead to first home game
text: tomorrow 's fa cup match for shrewsbury town will be extra special for paul hurst , because it will his be his first home game since becoming manager .
and he told us that he will need to figure out where to sit , because he likes to watch the first half of games up in the stands , rather than in the dug out .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shrewsbury mp confident on brexit timetable
text: shrewsbury 's conservative mp , daniel kawczynski says he has `` every confidence '' britain will leave the eu `` at the earliest opportunity '' .
that 's despite yesterday 's ruling by the high court , saying theresa may does n't have the power to trigger article 50 and would have to ask parliament 's permission first .
the government 's expected to appeal in the supreme court next month - and mr kawczynski says he can only see an outcome in favour of brexit .

i expect and hope that the supreme court will rule in favour of the prime minister , but even it comes to a vote in the house of commons , i have every confidence that the staunch remain labour mps , understand the fury that they would invoke in their constituencies , by voting to prevent the instigation . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: revised route for an £ 18m power line across north shropshire is published
text: a revised route for an £ 18m power line across the north shropshire countryside has been published .
sp energy networks says because of increased demand it needs to reinforce the network in north shropshire and provide additional capacity
it wants to link its substations in oswestry and wem with a new 132,000 volt power line - bypassing the villages and hamlets of babinswood , bagley marsh , cockshutt and noneley .
the energy company has completed its first consultation and made slight changes to the route .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: small schools in the county becoming financially unviable
text: small schools in shropshire and elsewhere are becoming financially unviable , according to one of the organisations that represents head teachers .

the government says it 's `` protecting '' school budgets , but independent experts say they 'll have 8 % less to spend on each pupil in real terms - to cover rises in pensions , pay and national insurance .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: headlines : call for end to hospital review delays ; telford company to be sentenced ; new power line route
text: our headlines this morning :
- council boss calls for end to hospital review delays
- telford company to be sentenced for health and safety breaches over band deaths
- revised route for shropshire power line is published
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: woman injured in bridgnorth crash
text: a woman 's been hurt in a crash on the ludlow road in bridgnorth .
the emergency services were called just after 22:00 to find the 20-year-old trapped in a car that had left the road and come to rest on its side .
she was cut free and taken russells hall hospital in dudley .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: top award for paralympic canoeist at county sports awards
text: nick beighton 's bronze medal at the paralym earned the shrewsbury canoeist the performance of the year award at last night 's energize county sports awards .
kickboxer adam summers won the junior version .
lawley running club 's alan crozier was volunteer of the year .
and the top coach trophy went to alan bircher from the ellesmere titans swimming club
author: Andrew Hewkin
Newsreader, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: telford company to be sentenced for fisherman 's friends deaths safety breaches
text: a telford company is due to be sentenced today for breaching health and safety rules which led to the death of a singer with the folk group , fisherman 's friends , and their tour manager .
trevor grills , 54 , and paul mcmullen , 44 , died when they were hit by a steel door supplied by david naylor 's telford-based company , at a concert in guildford .
mr naylor was found not guilty of manslaughter by gross negligence .
he released a statement - expressing relief over the verdict , but said his thoughts were with the families of mr grills and mr mcmullen as they have been for the past three and a half years .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: calls for health bosses to make final decision on future of healthcare
text: the conservative leader of shropshire council , malcolm pate , has called on health-bosses not to delay any further and make a decision about reorganising the county 's hospital care .
after several years of work and spending millions of pounds , the future fit team were close to making a decision a month ago .

but telford and wrekin council threatened legal action when it heard that the town 's a & e unit could be downgraded to an urgent-care centre , with women and children 's services moved to shrewsbury .
we think it 's a bit slow and a bit cumbersome perhaps , but our position is quite clear .
we want to see the best healthcare across shropshire that we possibly can .
that 's our council 's view .
my personal view is that i think they should keep both a & e departments . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: latest : calls for decision on hospital reorganisation ; telford company to be sentenced for health and safety breaches
text: the top stories in shropshire this morning :
- the conservative leader of shropshire council has called on health bosses not to delay any further in reorganising the county 's hospital care

documents.title: brexit blamed for telford job losses
text: the owners of the link 51 factory in telford say they will look to avoid as many job losses as possible , after announcing 69 posts are under threat .
the whittan group says it 's had to make changes because of `` recent steel price increases , turbulent market conditions , and the future uncertainty following the recent brexit vote '' .
it is planning to move its pallet racking production to milton keynes , but says it will handle the situation `` very sensitively '' with employees and has started a period of formal consultation .
talks with representatives of the unite union were due to be held today .

documents.title: watch : shrewsbury town captain talks about new manager
text: we spoke to shrewsbury town 's adam el-abd this afternoon and one of the things that came up was the new manager , paul hurst .
so , what does the team 's captain make of their new boss ?
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: severn valley railway share offer : 1,000 register interest on first day
text: more than 1,000 people registered their interest to buy shares at severn valley railway in the first day they were on sale
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: salmon patrols set up as fish head upriver
text: there 's still a chance to spot the salmon migrating upriver on the severn and teme as they head to their spawning grounds .
if you 've spotted them leaping on weirs in shropshire , we 'd love to see your photos .
you can email your photos to us , tweet us on @ twitterid share via facebook .
salmon protection patrols continue on the river teme above # ludow

documents.title: telford development plan delayed by illness
text: a plan that was meant to set out which parts of telford could be developed wo n't be ready until next year - because a government planning inspector is ill .
the local plan was drawn up by telford and wrekin council and will have to be taken into consideration when planning applications are made in the future .
the council says it regrets the announcement , but that it is out of its hands and hopes to learn of the new timetable soon .

documents.title: headlines : bridgnorth man not guilty over band deaths ; telford plan delayed ; shrewsbury captain impressed by hurst
text: our headlines this evening :
- bridgnorth company boss found not guilty over band deaths
- telford development master-plan held up by illness of government inspector
- shrewsbury town captain says new manager is a `` breath of fresh air ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: bridgnorth man 's relief after band deaths verdict
text: a bridgnorth man hugged his family in court after being found not guilty of causing the deaths of two men from the shanty band fisherman 's friends .
trevor grills and paul mcmullen died in 2013 when a steel door , supplied by david naylor 's company , fell on them at the g live venue in guildford .

afterwards , mr naylor released a statement saying that while he was relieved with the verdict , his `` thoughts are with the families of mr grills and mr mcmullen , as they have been for the last three and a half years '' .
the fisherman 's friends band also released a statement .
sadly nothing will bring our two good friends back home to their families and our thoughts are with them today .
it has been a long , difficult and emotional time for everyone connected with the case .
we hope what has happened today will enable us all to move forward . ''

documents.title: man cleared over shanty group gig deaths
text: man cleared over shanty group gig deaths

documents.title: football : shrewsbury look for riley-replacements
text: shrewsbury town 's manager paul hurst has confirmed that joe riley will have a knee operation on saturday .
and with injuries clearing up at the meadow , fit-again jack grimmer or the back-from-loan dom smith will come in at full-back against barnet at the weekend .

documents.title: police rated as good by government watchdog
text: west mercia police has been rated as good following a government inspection of all the forces across england and wales .
the report by hmic - also highlights a big drop in 999 calls made to the force - a drop of nearly 50 % in the last five years .
this means west mercia receives the lowest number of calls per head of population in the country .

documents.title: your photos : pictures of cloud over titterstone clee hill

author: Andy Giddings

documents.title: breakingbridgnorth man found not guilty over band deaths
text: a bridgnorth company boss has been found not guilty of the manslaughter by gross negligence of two men from the cornish shanty band fisherman 's friends .
the case was brought against 57-year-old david naylor after the deaths of trevor grills and paul mcmullen in february 2013 .
they were hit by a falling steel door , supplied by mr naylor , at the g live music venue in guildford .

after a trial lasting four-and-half-weeks at guildford crown court , his company , express hi-fold doors ltd has been found guilty of breaching a general duty of health and safety law and sentencing for that will take place tomorrow morning .

documents.title: ice hockey : miller looks to make comeback from concussion
text: tigers forward joe miller is hoping to make his comeback this weekend after being out for three weeks with concussion .
the welshman scored 61 points for telford last season and after suffering a hamstring injury in pre-season , he 's hoping this will be the end of his injury-problems .
the tigers have got two big games this weekend , travelling to milton keynes to play the lightning on saturday , before hosting the same opponents at the telford ice rink the following day .
it has been frustrating , especially after getting injured in pre-season training .
it 's been a bit stop-start , but hopefully the rest of the week will be good . ''

documents.title: tributes paid to shropshire grandfather killed by tractor
text: tributes have been paid to a grandfather-of-five who was killed in a tractor accident in shropshire .
author: Shropshire Star

documents.title: sports awards to celebrate county acheivements
text: the best of shropshire sport is being celebrated tonight with the county 's 10th annual sports awards ceremony .
a host of categories will celebrate what county sport is all about , from top achievers to volunteers , from coaches to community projects and clubs .
individual performers include canoeist nick beighton ( below ) and archer john walker , both medal winners at the rio paralym
the special guest handing out the trophies at the energize night at the telford international centre is britain 's 1988 olympic ski-jumper eddie `` the eagle '' edwards .
author: James Bond
Sports Producer, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire girl completes all three peaks by seventh birthday
text: here 's one little shropshire girl who 's just completed a huge ambition .
logan darbyshire from crew green set herself a challenge - to climb the highest peaks in england , scotland and wales by the time she turned seven .
and last month she did it .
not only did she finish her challenge , she also decided to raise money for the make a wish foundation .
she 's raised hundreds of pounds so far .
her parents bobby and dannii darbyshire say they 're both incredibly proud of her .

documents.title: football : former shrew heading for villa
text: the former shrewsbury defender david hughes is leaving his welsh fa coaching role - to become the youth coach at aston villa .
hughes was also a scout for the wales manager chris coleman during the euro 2016 finals .
author: BBC Sport

documents.title: new shropshire electricity line route is published
text: the proposed route of an £ 18m overhead power line to increase electricity capacity across north shropshire has been published .
author: Oswestry and Borders Chronicle

documents.title: hospital claims improvements to end-of-life care
text: the shrewsbury and telford hospital trust believes it 's made big improvements to its end-of-life care following criticism two years ago by the care quality commission .
the trust spent £ 500,000 on its mortuary facilities in shrewsbury after they were criticised by the cqc and says it has taken a number of other measures .
i spoke to jules lewis , the end of life care facilitator , who said conference on the subject today demonstrates how far they 've come in a short space of time .
author: Nick Southall
Journalist, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: missing telford man found safe and well
text: domantas pipiras who was missing from the stirchley area of telford has been found .
the 22-year-old was found yesterday afternoon and is safe , police say .

documents.title: memorial service for ludlow tapestry-maker
text: the life of a ludlow tapestry maker will be celebrated at his funeral this afternoon .
jack andow was originally in the royal navy , but took up needlework as a hobby after getting multiple sclerosis and earlier this year , jack received a letter from the queen .
a service will take place at st laurence 's church at 14:00 .

documents.title: third person taken to hospital after dawley crash
text: a third person has been taken to hospital after two cars crashed in dawley this morning .

roads around springhill road are still shut and the ambulance service says it initially took an 89-year-old man with head injuries and an 83-year-old woman with back and chest pain to the royal shrewsbury hospital .
the driver of the other car was a man in his 60s who suffered back and side pain , as well as a large cut to his head .
he was checked out at the scene and then later taken to the royal shrewsbury hospital for trauma care .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : development plan delay ; dawley crash ; council turns cheese into energy
text: our headlines this lunchtime :
- telford development plan delayed by illness to government inspector
- two taken to hospital after dawley crash
- council turns nearly 5,000 tonnes of unwanted cheese into energy
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: two taken to hospital after dawley crash
text: the air ambulance has been called to a crash in dawley .
emergency services are dealing with the incident on springhill road after an accident involving two cars .
one person has been cut free from their car and two people have already been taken to hospital .
police say the road could be closed for some time .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: cheese collapse investigation 'ongoing '
text: the collapse at the warehouse in hinstock saw a forklift driver trapped for about eight hours .
remarkably tomasz wiszniewski escaped major injury .
a health and safety investigation into the collapse is still ongoing and the authority says it is carrying out regular checks to make sure the cheese is being disposed of properly .

documents.title: weather : cloudy with the chance of showers
text: it 's going to be another cloudy afternoon with the chance of the odd shower in places .
author: Charlie Slater
BBC Weather presenter

documents.title: council appoints £ 90k officer to bring in new business
text: shropshire council has appointed a new member of staff on a salary of around £ 90,000 a year .
the woman , who 's not been named as she 's working out her notice at another local authority , will be tasked with attracting bigger companies into the county .

chief executive clive wright said they wanted to bring in the `` right sort of businesses '' and make use of soon-to-be-available sites like the former ironbridge power station and the clive barracks near market drayton .
author: Joanne Gallacher
Political reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: union talks today over job losses
text: representatives from the unite union are due to meet managers at a telford company today , to discuss job losses .
they say 69 full time posts and 20 agency jobs are being cut at link 51 in halesfield .
the firm produces storage systems for other companies .

documents.title: unwanted cheese turned into energy
text: how do you get rid of 5,000 tonnes of unwanted cheese ?
it seems the answer is to turn it into electricity .
on 6 may , rows of shelves collapsed at a warehouse in hinstock .
with no giant slices of toast available , shropshire council was keen to avoid the damaged goods being thrown into landfill .
work to dispose of the cheese began on 12 september and is now nearing completion .
adding it to an anaerobic digester means the cheese is being broken down into chemicals such has methane , carbon dioxide , which are in turn being used to generate electricity .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: travel : road in dawley closed by crash
text: the b4373 in dawley is closed in both directions between the station road junction and the heath hill roundabout .
police are directing traffic .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: eddie the eagle landing in shropshire later
text: the olympic legend eddie `` the eagle '' edwards is coming to the telford ski slope in madeley , this afternoon .
he 's been enjoying a resurgence in popularity since the eddie the eagle film was released in cinemas earlier this year .
he started young , and says he 's keen to inspire more youngsters to take up skiing .
who knows what it might lead to .
for me it led to the olympic games and becoming eddie the eagle . ''

documents.title: 'we need to act and we need to act quickly '
text: the words of shropshire 's new health commissioning boss .

simon freeman was called to a shropshire council scrutiny meeting yesterday to explain how the clinical commissioning group ( ccg ) , which he now heads , plans to save £ 26m - that 's £ 85 for every person in the shropshire council area .

he 's told shropshire councillors that the ccg ca n't carry on spending as it has been doing , and ca n't pretend the future wo n't be difficult - but he did assure them that the process of decommissioning and disinvestment would be open and transparent .
he says he wants to reduce the debt gradually - £ 6m in the next financial year , leaving a £ 20m shortfall by april 2018 .
author: Faith Page
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: woman sitting in living room when car crashed into house
text: a car crashed into a house while a woman sat in the lounge drinking a cup of tea just feet away , the fire service says .
the homeowner was left shaken but unhurt .
crews at the scene say it looks like a neighbour lost control and accidentally reversed into the front wall and window of a home on primrose drive on the sutton park estate in shrewsbury .

documents.title: weather watchers : an icy start across shropshire
text: my car was reading a rather chilly 3c this morning and it seems from our weather watchers there 's a similar across the county .

author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: fire crews working to remove car from house
text: structural engineers have been called to the home on primrose drive in sutton park , shrewsbury .
a car reversed into the house just after 07:00 this morning .
the front wall and windows of the house have been damaged , with photos showing the back of the car embedded in the building .

text: jim hawkins wants to hear all about first dates this morning .
it 's after a stranger paid for a new couple 's first date after hearing them discussing their money troubles .
be them strange , weird , unusual - jim wants to hear all about your first date experiences .
you can call the show on 01743 248321 or text 81333 starting your message with the word shrop .
and you can get in touch via twitter and facebook .

text: it happened at 7:15am this morning on primrose drive , and firefighters from wellington and shrewsbury are on the scene .

documents.title: cash for under-threat leisure centre
text: the closure-threatened sparc leisure centre in bishop 's castle has won an energy competition .
it 'll get around £ 13,000 from marks & spencer after polling the most votes in its region .

the money will be spent on a new cover for the centre 's swimming pool , saving 15 % of its daily energy costs , and campaigners hope it will help attract a company to take the centre over , if shropshire council decides to cut its funding .
dorrington and diddlebury village halls did n't get enough votes to win a share of the m & s money .

documents.title: arson advice for farmers
text: police are issuing advice to farmers after a number of sus fires in north shropshire this autumn .

they say arson attacks `` may be difficult to completely eliminate '' , but suggest a number of measures , such as storing hay and straw separately from fuels and locking up fuels , fertilisers and pesticides .
west mercia police also says it has stepped up patrols in the area .
farms can be particularly vulnerable to arson .
due to their often-isolated locations , open boundaries and readily ignitable hay and straw , it can make them an easy target . ''

documents.title: fuel thieves escape through fields after being caught red-handed
text: fuel has been stolen from two lorries in shropshire - with the culprits running off into fields after being caught in the act .
author: Bridgnorth Journal

documents.title: midlands metro mayor : what 's it about ?
text: midlands metro mayor : what 's it about ?
author: Patrick Burns
Political editor, Midlands

documents.title: search for new shropshire cricket umpires
text: a search is under way for the next generation of cricket umpires in shropshire , with a training course due to start in the new year .
the shropshire association of cricket officials is holding the sessions at allscott sports & social club near telford each monday evening from 9 january .
the level 1 course , which costs £ 70 , is open to anyone aged 14 or above and ends with exams in march .
the course focuses on the laws of cricket , their meaning and interpretation , providing the skills , and instilling the confidence to enjoy being an essential part of the game . ''

documents.title: funding offer in bid to resolve bus dispute
text: shropshire council says it has made an offer to powys county council , in an attempt to preserve a bus route between rhayader and shrewsbury .
shropshire council withdrew its funding for the x75 route a number of years ago , but wants to see passengers up here in the county .
at the moment the powys county council-funded service up and drops off in ford , wattlesborough and halfway house , but that 's due to stop next month .
it is highly important to us that we do n't allow shropshire residents to become isolated . ''

documents.title: headlines : attempted abduction investigators release plans for homes overturned ; telford job cut talks
text: our headlines this evening :
- police release of a man they want to talk to over attempted child abductions
- high court overturns planning approval for 68 ellesmere homes
- unions to hold talks over telford factory job cuts
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: severn trent looks for pumpkin power
text: used halloween pumpkins are being used to create electricity by severn trent , which is throwing them into its anaerobic digestion plant located in coleshill .
the company has been asking its staff to bring them in and says one 600g ( 1.3lb ) pumpkin could power a light bulb for 24 hours .
the coleshill plant produces 2.4mw of energy a year - the equivalent of powering 4,000 homes .
pumpkins , like all food waste , are packed with energy which with a bit of ingenuity can be unlocked and turned into power . ''
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your photos : sunny scenes from around shropshire today
text: we 've had a real variety of photos shared by the bbc weather watchers today .
they all seem to show the sun in some form or another , but they vary from the bright blue skies captured in this taken near bridgnorth .
to this slightly cloudier scene taken near market drayton .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: union holds talks over telford factory job losses
text: the unite union says it will be holding `` crunch '' talks with management at the link 51 plant in telford tomorrow .
the business is planning to shed 69 jobs at halesfield , with its pallet racking operations moving to milton keynes instead .
the union said it hoped to reduce the impact of the job losses , by finding new work for the staff elsewhere and by insisting that the company asks for volunteers .

this is a long-established business in telford and the announcement of the redundancies is a tough blow for our members and their families , as well as the shropshire economy , in the run-up to christmas . ''

documents.title: two arrested in wellington after immigration raids
text: two men have been arrested by police in conjunction with home office immigration enforcement officers after two raids in wellington .
a 30-year-old and a 25-year-old were held on immigration offences after the raids on premises in whitchurch road and the high street .
the uk border agency has been informed .

documents.title: more schools destroy chemical
text: since we reported yesterday on the controlled explosion carried out at thomas adams school in wem , there have been more reports of schools destroying their stocks of a potentially dangerous chemical .

known as 2,4-dinitrophenylhydrazine , it has been used in a-level chemistry lessons to identify carbon groups , but schools around the country are being advised to destroy it , if it has dried out in its container .
west mercia police say they have been called out to support controlled explosions in redditch and evesham and more been reported this morning in nottingham and in swansea .
neil crumpton , the head of science at ludlow c of e school , told bbc radio shropshire this morning he understood the chemical was no longer needed .

from what i can gather the a-level syllabus regarding this chemical has changed and so there is n't the requirement to use it , which is why there have been a number of disposals across the country . ''

documents.title: elderly woman hurt in butane explosion
text: a woman has been treated in hospital after a butane gas container exploded in her kitchen .

the 70-year-old suffered burns to her face after the aerosol-type container went off at her home in minsterley this morning and she was given first aid at the scene before being taken off in ambulance .
the fire service was also called , but the fire had been put out before they got there .
author: James Bond
Reporter, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: police investigating attempted child abductions release artist 's impression
text: this artist 's impression has been released of a man police want to talk to in connection with what appears to be two attempted child abductions in the oswestry area .

the first was in weston rhyn on 12 october when a man tried to persuade an 11-year-old to get into his car and the second took place on 18 october when a man tried to up a 13-year-old girl in his van .
in both cases the man is described as having a liverpudlian accent and parents are being urged not to let their children walk to and from school alone .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: headlines : artist 's impression of child abduction suspect ; plans for ellesmere homes overturned ; ukip donor wants evans out
text: here 's a round-up of our top stories this afternoon :
- police investigating attempted child abductions release artists impression of suspect

author: Andy Giddings

documents.title: your photos : a chilly day around shropshire
text: it 's been a chilly morning in shropshire and you can almost feel the chill in some of these photos sent in by the bbc weather watchers .
these ones were taken on hills just outside ludlow ( top ) and near broseley ( bottom ) .
author: BBC Weather Watchers

documents.title: shropshire scouts looking for more leaders
text: the increase in the number of children joining the beavers , cubs and scouts in shropshire has been welcomed by the scout association here , but it has also increased demand for new leaders in the county .
its county appointments officer , roy webster , told bbc radio shropshire that some groups have got plenty of leaders , but others are struggling at the moment .

mr webster encouraged more people to sign up , saying it was a chance to `` do things you would n't think or dream of doing '' and revealed he had discovered a love of potholing through trying it as a scout leader .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: shropshire canal group bidding for £ 1m lottery cash
text: canal enthusiasts will submit a bid for £ 1m worth of lottery funding next week in a bid to reopen an historic wharf near telford .
author: Newport Advertiser

documents.title: council defends challenge to its local development plan
text: a planning inspector 's decision to allow 68 homes to be built in ellesmere has been overturned after shropshire council took the case to the high court in london .

and the council says this holds much wider significance , because the inspector 's decision had been casting doubts over the strength of its local development plan , which was meant to control where homes could be built in the county .

shropshire council says that after the inspector made his original decision to allow the homes to be built , other developers had starting quoting it in their own appeals , arguing it demonstrated less attention needed to be paid to the local plan - which only came into force 10 months ago .
meanwhile , the ellesmere plans will now go back to the planning inspectorate , to look at again .

documents.title: football : fa youth cup success for shrewsbury
text: shrewsbury town 's under-18s are through to the second round of the fa youth cup after beating wolverhampton casuals 5-1 .
ryan sears scored twice and john mcatee , matt jones and george hassall also found the net against their non-league opponents .

documents.title: ukip donor wants suzanne evans and others kicked out of party
text: ukip 's biggest donor , aaron banks , says the party needs to `` cleanse '' itself of a number of high-profile figures , including shrewsbury-based leadership candidate suzanne evans .

mr banks said she and ukip mp douglas carswell and welsh party leader neil hamilton had formed a `` fifth column '' which had caused the party and its former leader nigel farage trouble and he threatened to stop donating to the party unless they leave .

in an email to supporters , he said he would be supporting paul nuttall as party leader , but added : `` i doubt whether he has the strength to deal with the career politicians that have come into the party . ''

documents.title: whitchurch herald front page : honour for golf course founder
text: the founder of hill valley golf course and hotel is to have a new housing development named after him in honour of his service to the town .
author: Whitchurch Herald

documents.title: on midlands today from 13:30 : life after being an olympian and paralympian
text: life after the olym - what happens when you 've spent your whole life training as a top sportsperson and then one day , it stops and that 's all over .
well today in part of the midlands , olympians and paralympians have been getting advice on life after sport and how to get a job .
we 'll have more on bbc midlands today from 13:30 on bbc one .
author: BBC Midlands Today

documents.title: nfu urges vigilance over spate of arson attacks on farms
text: the national farmers union in shropshire is urging you to come forward if you have any sus about a relative , work colleague or friend , who may be carrying out arson attacks on local farms .
it comes after one farmer in the north of the county lost hundreds of tonnes of straw , worth thousands of pounds , after arsonists targeted his farm twice in just over a week .
chairman of the nfu richard yates says it 's important for you to contact the police , if you know anything .
now is the opportunity to nip it in the bud .
this problem will inevitably snowball and lead to greater tragedy .
death of animals , farmers , general public .
i ask people to act now .
call police , crimestoppers , share your burden , do the right thing . ''
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: missing telford family found
text: good news - the police say they 've been able to trace a lithuanian family who had been missing from their home in stirchley since the weekend .
martynas norvisas and leva stupelyte and their one-year-old godie norvdidiaare are said to be safe and well .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: conservative councillor fears newport is being over developed
text: the leader of telford and wrekin council 's minority conservative group has repeated his fear that newport 's in danger of becoming over developed .
andrew eade 's trying to stop 17 houses being built in church aston .
the council 's planning committee meets this afternoon , and mr eade is hoping they 'll make changes to the application .

documents.title: police appeal to trace missing man
text: west mercia police want your help in finding a man from telford who 's gone missing .
domantas pipiras , 32 , was last seen on sunday evening in the stirchley area .
he 's described as white , tall and of slim build .
he has short dark hair and looks young for his age .
police want to know he 's safe and well .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: ice hockey : excitement mounting for weekend double header
text: telford tigers say the excitement is mounting for this weekend 's double-header with milton keynes .

defenceman adam jones says even at this stage of the season `` it 's a crucial pair of games '' .

text: afc telford united have suspended one of their players .

documents.title: number of children joining the scouts in the county on the increase
text: the number of children joining the scouts in shropshire has gone up by more than 100 , compared with four years ago .

documents.title: consultation on primary school merger , ends
text: a consultation on the merger of three small south shropshire primary schools ends today .
the plan is to close the schools at westbury and hope , and move the pupils to worthen , despite hope being rated `` good '' by inspectors .
both worthen and westbury have been told to improve .
between them , the schools have lost almost a quarter of their pupils just this year .
they 're also struggling to recruit teaching staff .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

text: many of you will have seen the first frost this morning , after temperatures plummeted last night .

text: the future of shropshire 's hospitals was supposed to be laid bare this week , but today it emerged a decision may be delayed yet again because of legal concerns .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: man proposes in hospital before getting rare tumour removed
text: a man 's proposed to his girlfriend from his hospital bed as he was waiting for surgery to remove a bone tumour .
andrew estcourt , 44 , from winterley near crewe was having an operation on a rare tumour on his leg at the robert jones and agnes hunt orthopaedic hospital near oswestry , shropshire .
while he was there he enlisted the help of doctors and nurses to spring a surprise proposal on his girlfriend selina lawton at his bedside - and she said yes .
she was knocked back a bit really , but instantly she said : 'of course i will ! '
i had this whole proposal speech planned out , but i ended up just blurting it out . ''
author: Lucy King
News Editor, BBC Radio Stoke

documents.title: boys at school specialising in autism , caught buying toxic substances on the internet
text: school inspectors visited cruckton hall school near shrewsbury earlier this month , after receiving concerns about the safety and welfare of the boys .
the school caters for up to 92 boys , who are on the autistic spectrum .
they found that boys had been buying potentially toxic substances off the internet and also one had developed an interest in getting hold of materials that could be explosive .
staff at cruckton were criticised for delaying questioning the boys involved , which inspectors said had put pupils at risk .
staff have also been undergoing training and refresher courses in areas such as radicalisation .
author: Tracey Higgins
BBC Local Live

documents.title: fire service not told about controlled chemical explosion at school
text: west mercia police has confirmed the fire service was n't informed before a controlled explosion at a school in shropshire on monday night .
fire crews from three stations were scrambled to thomas adams school in wem after neighbours heard the blast .
bomb disposal experts were dealing with a chemical at the school , after a national warning about how it should be kept .
but police say the decision to destroy the chemicals was `` immediate '' , and did n't require the fire service to be involved .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

documents.title: telford mp defends street pastor over cse comments
text: the mp for telford has defended the right of police chaplain keith osmund-smith to speak out on child sex exploitation in the town - following the news the police have responded by asked him to take a break from the role .
lucy allan said she found the development and the news the police were investigating his comments `` very concerning indeed '' and said he `` did the right thing in speaking out '' .
ms allan said mr osmund-smith has seen `` first hand what is on the streets '' and that she wanted the subject of child sex exploitation discussed , to break down taboos .

documents.title: headlines : investigation into tractor death ; barn fire believed to be arson ; afc telford hit fundraising target
text: our headlines this evening :
- hse investigates after man in 60s killed by tractor near bishop 's castle
- police believe wistanswick barn fire was started deliberately
- afc telford united reach £ 25,000 fundraising target for october
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your questions : what do we know about nissen hut camps in shropshire ?
text: the question we answered last week about oakengate 's nissen huts has had a good response .

the man with the initial enquiry , john cosh , sent us this photo showing him stood outside the hut ( wearing the shorts ) with his brother and his mother and he said `` i still have vivid memories of happy days spent in our hut and surrounding area . ''
and local historian phil fairclough was able to find this photo of the first british family moving into an oakengates hut after the italian pows had left .

phil has spent a lot of time researching shropshire 's 18 former pow camps and says that the only remaining nissen huts in the county can be found at bank top at st martins - they have been converted into industrial units .

and once the pows had left he said some became home to european workers , brought in to help on our farms , including a number from the royal yugoslav army , who helped set up donnington 's serbian orthodox church .
if you have a question you 'd like us to look into , get in touch .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: tractor death investigated by hse
text: the health and safety executive has started an investigation into the death of a man in his 60s at a farm near bishop 's castle yesterday .
the police say it appears the man , who died after becoming trapped under a tractor , was the driver .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: afc telford united reach £ 25,000 target
text: afc telford united have reached their target of raising £ 25,000 in october .
the club says £ 14,974 of that came through increased support through the turnstiles and another £ 8,187 came through donations .
the remainder came through new sponsors .
telford has set itself a target of raising £ 25,000 in october and november , to help it out of a difficult financial position and is urging fans to continue their support this month .

documents.title: wistanswick barn fire continues to burn
text: the fire service are still at the scene of the fire which destroyed a barn near wistanswick overnight .
it says the straw is being allowed to burn down by itself now and that smoke is still visible from the a41 .
the police are treating the fire as arson .

documents.title: travel : collision partially closing road at llynclys
text: the a495 at llynclys has been partially blocked near the junction of the a483 after a collision between a car and a bus .
the road is passable , but traffic is slow .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: watch : neighbours surprised by explosion at school
text: people living near the thomas adams school in wem have been speaking about their surprise at the explosion there last night .
it was carried out to dispose of some hazardous chemicals , following national guidelines , but some have complained that they should have been warned in advance .
irene fillmore said there were a number of elderly people living in the immediate area .

documents.title: patient pops the question in hospital ward
text: an orthopedic hospital patient has proposed to his girlfriend - even though he could n't physically get down on one knee .
andrew estcourt , 44 , was helped by staff at the oswestry hospital , who gathered friends and family for the moment and bought some flowers .
his son turned up with the ring .
mr estcourt was in to have a tumour removed from his sciatic nerve and had been planning to pop the question to selina lawtonin portugal , but was told he needed to have the operation immediately .
she was knocked back a bit really , but instantly she said : 'of course i will ! '
i had this whole proposal speech planned out but i ended up just blurting it out . ''

documents.title: headlines : hunt for missing telford family ; man killed by tractor ; afc telford united reach fundraising target
text: a recap of our top stories this afternoon :
- young family goes missing from telford
- man killed after being knocked down by tractor near bishops castle
- afc telford united reach fundraising target
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: lorry gets stuck in bridgnorth street
text: police have shared this photo of a lorry getting stuck in bridgnorth earlier .
they say the driver took a wrong turn and got stuck at the junction of high street while trying to correct his error .
and they have thanked three local lorry drivers who turned up to help him get out .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: man killed by rolling tractor
text: man killed by rolling tractor

documents.title: adams ' grammar pupil enters cbbc 's junior bake off tent
text: a schoolboy whizz with a whisk has landed a spot in this year 's junior bake off television competition .
author: Newport Advertiser

documents.title: shropshire bobsledder uncertain about russian competition
text: a shropshire bobsledder and his team are weighing up whether to compete in next year 's world championships in the russian city of sochi .

broseley 's ben simons was part of the british team which went there for the winter olym but he says he has n't got `` much confidence '' in the drug-testing regime at the moment , following the allegations of widespread russian cheating .
simons said the issue of whether to travel was `` up in the air at the moment '' .

we get a lot of drug tests and doing it in a country where these things may or may not have gone on it just does n't give me much confidence as an athlete when everything in the uk is so stringent . ''

documents.title: hunt for missing telford family
text: a family has gone missing from the stirchley area of telford .
the police say 24-year-old martynas norvisas , leva stupelyte ( also 24 ) and their one-year-old godie norvdidia have not been seen since sunday evening .
it 's possible they have driven outside the force area , police say , but it would be out of character for them to leave their home and their jobs like this .

documents.title: schools issued advice on dangerous chemical
text: an advisory body has been explaining why schools like the thomas adams school in wem have been advised to dispose of one of their chemicals .

the consortium of local education authorities for the provision of science services ( cleapss ) explains that 2,4-dinitrophenylhydrazine is used to identify carbon groups and is perfectly safe if stored correctly .
but , it says action needs to be taken if there is evidence it has dried out , because it could cause burns .
destroying it with an explosion is one option and it said the action taken in wem was proportionate and the key message was it did n't want to cause a panic .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: police say barn fire suspected arson
text: police are now saying they are treating the barn fire at wistanswick overnight as arson .
a barn containing 600 tonnes of straw was on fire and the fire service have been there this morning dealing with it .

documents.title: headlines : man killed by tractor ; school explosion 'proportionate ' ; railway share officer
text: our headlines this lunchtime :
- man dies after being run over by tractor near bishops castle
- school explosion was `` proportionate '' says advisory body
- severn valley railway launches £ 2.5m share offer
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: nursery teacher shortage 'risks children 's learning '
text: there 's concern over the lack of nursery teachers in the county .
figures out today say 81 % of children in independent nurseries in the shropshire council area are without a qualified teacher .
for telford & wrekin the figure is 54 % .
save the children , which commissioned the data , is warning there 's a shortage of 10,000 trained nursery teachers across england .
it 's called on the government to invest urgently in the sector .

documents.title: man dies after tractor crash
text: a man has died after being hit by a tractor near bishops castle .
west midlands ambulance service says it was called to a field off arbour lane at 13:50 yesterday and were told the tractor had struck him after rolling down a hill .
he was trapped under the vehicle when they arrived and died at the scene despite attempts to save him .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: weather : dark cloud clearing later
text: the cloud is going to get quite dark in places this afternoon , but it 's forecast to clear by the end of the day .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: severn valley railway shares to fund a range of improvements
text: the severn valley railway has put 2.5m shares up for sale this morning , to help pay for a major revamp of its bridgnorth station .

they 're being sold for £ 1 each and the money will be spent on upgrading the station 's railway building to create a new refreshment room , waiting room and toilets along with the creation of a turntable and improvements to the car park .
there will be a range of extra benefits for people buying over 100 shares and they 'll remain on offer until 31 october next year .

documents.title: farmer hit by second huge blaze in the space of a week
text: a north shropshire farmer who lost hundreds of tonnes of straw in a fire last week has been targeted again overnight .
adrian marsh was alerted to the latest blaze in the early hours of this morning .
he says 700-800 tonnes of straw have been lost this time , costing him about £ 65,000 .
fire investigators are urging you to call police if you know anything .

documents.title: mother 'lucky to be alive ' after stroke during pregnancy
text: a mother who suffered a stroke when she was eight months pregnant says she is lucky to be alive '' after undergoing pioneering treatment to remove blood clots from her brain .
author: Telford Journal

documents.title: drunk daughter behind 'girls forced into car ' alert
text: a report that two teenage girls were reportedly seen being forced into a car turned out to be parents up a drunk daughter .
west mercia police launched an urgent appeal after a member of the public reported the incident in wellington on sunday .
the parent of one girl contacted officers to say she and her husband were in the car .
the force said the initial report from glebe street was made `` in good faith '' .

documents.title: controlled explosion was 'last minute decision ' says school
text: thomas adams school in wem says they were left with little time to warn nearby residents ahead of last night 's controlled explosion .
there 's been criticism on the school 's facebook page with some saying the loud bang was `` immense '' and called into question the timing of it .
a statement has been posted on facebook saying the school was following advice from the bomb disposal squad and were not aware how big the bang would be .
we do apologise to the public for any distress caused but , of course , we were following police instructions . ''

documents.title: headlines : school criticised after explosion ; police chaplain asked to step down ; large barn fire

documents.title: watch : large barn fire in wistanswick
text: a barn full of approximately 600 tonnes of straw is on fire in north shropshire .
crews from market drayton and hodnet are dealing with the blaze at wistanswick near market drayton .
just last week we were reporting on a similar fire in the same area .
fire investigators are urging people to call police if they know anything about the blazes .
incident : short video showing the scene of the # wistanswick fire .
crews from # marketdrayton and # hodnet on scene @ twitterid @ twitterid
hi guys , any chance would you be able to email me this footage to nathan.rowden @ shropshirestar.co.uk ?
hi nathan will try and send it now
thanks for that .
having trouble with it for some reason .
is there a separate fire in forton ?
cheers
hi , we understand our colleagues from @ twitterid are attending an ongoing incident in the forton area .
thanks for the information

documents.title: steam railway launches share scheme
text: steam railway launches share scheme

documents.title: police chaplain investigated over exploitation comments
text: a baptist minister has been asked to step aside from his role as a police chaplain after he spoke out about child sexual exploitation in telford .
keith osmund-smith has been the force 's shropshire-based chaplain for the past nine years but has been told to leave his post until the new year or face suspension .
he told the daily mirror he had doubts information passed to officers about child sex exploitation was always acted on .
west mercia police confirmed an internal investigation was taking place but declined to comment further .
mr osmund smith does not want to comment but it 's understood that he 's very sad and disappointed by the way he 's been treated .

documents.title: school under fire over explosions on halloween
text: a school is coming under fire after a stash of old chemicals were blown up on halloween without neighbours being warned .

police were supervising the controlled explosion at the thomas adams school in wem , shropshire , but some have complained on the school 's facebook page about the lack of advance notice to people living nearby .
one said the noise was `` immense '' and `` worrying '' , especially when families were out playing trick or treat with little children .
three fire engines were sent to the scene , but were stood down when it emerged what was happening .
the school is open as usual this morning .
author: Tim Page
News Editor, BBC Shropshire

text: there 's going to be a spooky fog in the air tonight and there could be some remaining tomorrow morning too .
author: Sara Blizzard
BBC Weather

documents.title: police crackdown on motorists using phones
text: there 's going to be a crackdown by west mercia police on motorists using mobile phones at the wheel .
the force says it 's going to carry out checks on the road over the next few weeks , using unmarked cars and also wants to educate drivers about the dangers .
driving while using a mobile phone was made a specific offence in 2003 and is punishable with a £ 100 fine and three points on your licence .
west mercia says that if it catches drivers with no previous mobile phone convictions , they will be offered a presentation on the risks as an alternative .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: watch : gp at new whitchurch surgery talks about challenges ahead
text: the first patients have been admitted to whitchurch 's newest doctor 's surgery today .
the service , run by the county 's shropdoc gp group , is meant to be an 18-month stop-gap measure - until a new surgery can be set up .
it will serve around 4,000 patients and we spoke to one of the first gps to work there , melanie abey .

documents.title: sunday third busiest day of year for 999 calls
text: sunday was the third busiest day of the year for 999 calls , according to west midlands ambulance service .
in total , the trust received 3,591 emergency calls across the region , compared with 3,154 the weekend before .
managers blamed a combination of halloween , diwali , a payday weekend and an extra hour , due to the clocks going back .
they praised staff who `` worked incredibly hard to ensure patients continued to receive excellent care '' .
only new year 's day and 19 july , when temperatures soared , were busier .

documents.title: arctic convoy veterans remembered
text: a shropshire naval engineer who served on the arctic convoys in world war two has been attending a commemoration event at liverpool town hall today .
it is 75 years since the royal navy convoys were sent to provide supplies to russians fighting on the eastern front , costing the lives of over 3,000 men and one in every 20 vessels sent .
in all , between 3.5 and four million tonnes of cargo , including aircraft and tanks , were sent .
the crews were praised today by first sea lord admiral sir philip jones for their `` extraordinary heroism and singular fortitude '' .

sid speke from sutton maddock , served on two trips to russia and the 95-year-old said he remembered the cold weather and he was lucky on one occasion when german destroyers missed them with torpedoes .
the greatest thing , of course , is to think that i 'm a survivor . ''

documents.title: west mercia police 'need to improve '
text: police in west mercia need to do better to improve the experience of victims of crime , the police and crime commissioner says .
`` at times we do n't cover ourselves in glory , '' john campion said .
today he launched the safer west mercia plan , outlining his vision for policing in the area .

it includes using technology better , `` stopping the slide of increased response times '' and making sure there were enough specialist staff to do the job - armed response , counter terrorism and serious organised crime officers , among others .
we still get over £ 200m a year and i think i 'm given enough resources to deliver a good level of service , as long as i 'm getting better value for money . ''

documents.title: businessman jailed for failing to pay taxes
text: a bridgnorth businessman has been for jailed for 32 months for failing to declare his income to the tax authorities .
hmrc said alan smithyman , 63 , failed to pay over £ 250,000 in taxes while serving as a director on 13 companies between 2005 and 2012 .
he had pleaded guilty of two counts of `` cheating the public revenue '' at an earlier hearing at manchester crown court .
smithyman had a substantial business empire with money being transferred all over the place .
but he told hmrc he had n't earned a penny .
this was a deliberate attempt to avoid his tax obligations and pocket the cash . ''

documents.title: work on shrewsbury maternity takes longer than expected
text: work that closed shrewsbury 's maternity unit is still ongoing , more than a fortnight after it started .
the hospital trust originally said the work should only take two weeks .
it 's now thought the unit will reopen in the next few days .

documents.title: met office issues yellow warning for fog
text: more fog on the way tomorrow morning .
yellow warning of fog for west midlands : shropshire , staffordshire , stoke-on-trent , telford and wrekin , here

documents.title: headlines : mobile phone crackdown ; businessman jailed for failing to pay taxes ; hill fort to be cleared of trees
text: our headlines this evening :
- police plan crackdown on motorists using mobile phones
- bridgnorth businessman given 32-month sentence for failing to pay tax
- trees to be cleared from nesscliffe hill fort
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: trees to be cleared off hill fort
text: a two-month operation to clear most of the trees off nesscliffe hill fort is due to start next monday .
shropshire council says they have to go because a number of trees have blown down , damaging the scheduled ancient monument .
the authority says the work will be completely paid for by the timber it sells .
author: Andy Giddings
BBC Shropshire

documents.title: your comments : meole brace roundabout revamp dividing opinion
text: the changes to the meole brace roundabout in shrewsbury have attracted some criticism , and the subject is being debated on bbc shropshire 's facebook page as well .

steve bowers agrees that the work needs to be done , to prepare the roundabout for increasing demand in the future , writing : `` at this stage yes it 's hard to see why it 's needed as sutton grange is the only developer , but when the others come it will be gridlock . ''
sarah ann richards writes : `` it 's not the roundabout that 's at fault , it 's bad driving at roundabouts half the time .
i must admit getting in and out of the retail park has always been a nightmare .
poor design . ''
nev nevey nevster : `` it 's not the roundabout that 's the problem .
it 's getting in and out of the retail park that 's the problem !
that 's what they should be looking at . ''

documents.title: unwanted shropshire fire engines a big upgrade for romanians
text: shropshire firefighters have led aid missions to poor communities in romania , bulgaria , hungary , poland and czechia ( formerly known as the czech republic ) and delivered more than 20 redundant fire engines .
this was the latest one , which is out-of-service in this country .
but , as you can see , it 's a lot better than what the fire service over there already has .
local firefighting volunteers are also given training and uniforms , and the team have been spending time decorating a child protection centre and delivering aid to an old people 's home .

documents.title: football : manager of the month award for tns boss
text: craig harrison has won the welsh premier league 's manager of the month award for the second month in succession .
he led his side to four victories during october to continue their perfect start to the season .
tns beat aberystwyth town , llandudno , newtown and connah 's quay , conceding just one goal in the process .

documents.title: small acid leak in whitchurch
text: fire crews have been dealing with a `` small acid leak '' on terrick road in whitchurch this lunchtime .
firefighters equipped to deal with hazardous materials and the environmental protection unit were called .
an ambulance was also called but the incident was dealt with quickly .
author: Carlie Swain
BBC Local Live

documents.title: e-cig charger warning
text: the fire service is warning everyone to use the correct chargers after dealing with a house fire started by an e-cigarette vapouriser connected up to a mobile phone plug .
it tweeted this photo and suggested people read the instructions carefully , because smartphone chargers are n't built to deal with the power from e-cigarettes devices .

documents.title: headlines : roundabout revamp justified ; small acid leak in whitchurch ; firefighters thanked by romanians
text: our headlines this afternoon :
- council warns of gridlock if roundabout revamp not carried out
- small acid leak in whitchurch
